result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon R Tallman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to probation by 4:00 PM, Friday, May 8, 2015. 
If probation recommends release after 3 years, the court will consider same.

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 cash bond applied. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia unless prescribed to him and in the amounts prescribed. 
Must have no contact with Kimberly A.

05/15/2015 CORRECTED TO ADD THE COURT ORDERED CONDITION: MUST MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

05/18/15 CORRECTED TO CHANGE THE PREVIOUS CORRECTED DATE FROM 05/08/2015 TO 5/15/2015

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants 150 days jail credit if revoked.

18CF169 - Plea/Sentencing Hearing
State moves to amend Count 3 to 961.41(3g)(g) as a repeater 939.62(1)(b) - Court grants amendment.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Defense and State waive PSI.  Court questions Defendant.  Court waives PSI.

State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:
